quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Argentina and Sudan
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mean, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Argentine Cockade is of the same colors as the national flag of Argentina.
The Falklands War was fought in 1982 between Argentina and this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the UK

questions.question: At the age of 15 Eva Peron went to Buenos Aires to pursue a career as which of the following?
The national anthem of Sudan is entitled Nahnu Jund Allah Jund Al-watan. What does this mean in Arabic?

options.text: This is the land and the people of God.
God has chosen us for his army.
We are the army of God and of our land.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: We are the army of God and of our land.

questions.question: What kind of object is the jalabiya, which is an inseparable part of Sudanese culture?
The Sun of May, one of the national emblems of Argentina, is a representation of an Inca god.
What is the official language in Sudan as enacted by the laws of the country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arabic and English

questions.question: Argentina declared independence from Spain in 1816.
Which of these statements is true about Sudan?

options.text: It is the seventh-largest country on the planet.
It is the largest country in the Arab World.
It is the second-largest country in Africa.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the largest country in the Arab World.

questions.question: What is the capital city of Sudan?
Peronism is a term referring to an Argentine political movement.
What animal is a national symbol of Argentina?
What does the name of Sudan mean in Arabic?
During the War of the Triple Alliance the allied countries of Argentina, Brazil, and Uruguay fought against what country?
What type of governmental control does Sudan have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Greece and Holy Mountain
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, mary, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the official language in Ecuador?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spanish and Quechua

questions.question: In what century was the Holy Mountain in Greece conquered by the Ottoman Empire?
How many Eastern Orthodox monasteries are there in the Holy Mountain in Greece?
According to an ancient story Virgin Mary and St. John were sailing to Cyprus to visit this Biblical figure, when their ship was blown off course to the then pagan Holy Mountain.
In the 1930s, the first Greek beauty pageant contestant to win the Miss Europe titled sneaked into the Holy Mountain dressed up as a man.
In Greek Mythology Athos was the name of which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a giant

questions.question: What is the title of the national anthem of he Socialist Republic of Vietnam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Army March

questions.question: What is the largest monastery on the Holy Mountain in Greece?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Lavra

questions.question: The self-governed region of the Holy Mountain is considered part of the Greek state according to a decree
What type of governmental control does Ecuador have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Presidential republic

questions.question: What are colors of the outfits of the national football (soccer) team of Sudan, when playing home and away respectively?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red and white

questions.question: In the 7th century, after the Islamic conquest of this territory many orthodox monks went to the Holy Mountain in Greece in an attempt to find another calm place.
Women are prohibited to enter the monasteries in the Holy Mountain in Greece.
Where does the name of Ecuador come from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The equator

questions.question: The Holy Mountain, which is located in Greece, is also known by this name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount Athos

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Vietnam and Type
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, sustenance, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the largest religious group in Vietnam according to official data?
What type of animal is the Saola, an extremely rare species living only in Vietnam and Laos?
What part of traditional Vietnamese culture is the ao dai?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A garment

questions.question: The fortress Castillo de la Real Fuerza on the western side of the harbour in Havana was built as a defence against pirate attacks.
What type of game is the traditional Vietnamese game called O an quan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Board game

questions.question: What are the colors on the national flag of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellow and red

questions.question: In 2008, Fidel Castro was succeeded as President of Cuba by his son Raul.
What type of meal is the traditional Vietnamese dish called Pho?
The cultivation of what plant has been a basic sustenance for Vietnams population for millennia?
Which of these popular Cuban cocktails is made of Cola, lime, and white rum?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cuba Libre

questions.question: Name the famous restaurant in Havana where Ché and Fidel Castro toasted the success of the Revolution.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Castillo de Farnes

questions.question: What is the capital city of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam?
The Bay of Pigs Invasion of 1961 was an unsuccessful attempt to overthrow the Cuban government of Fidel Castro.
What is the official language for the territory of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam?
What restaurant-bar of Havana is the birth place of the Mojito cocktail, prepared since its opening in 1942?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: La Bodeguita del Medio

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Jamaica and City
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, athlete, bird. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Name the national anthem of Jamaica, written by Hugh Sherlock, composed by Robert Lightbourne and arranged by Mapletoft Poulle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jamaica, Land We Love

questions.question: What city is the capital and the largest city of Jamaica?
Which of these famous Cubans was born in Santa Clara, the capital city of the Cuban province of Villa Clara?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of them

questions.question: What bird is the national bird of Jamaica as well as one of the symbols of the country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Doctor Bird

questions.question: What music genre originated in Jamaica?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Bacardi is a company founded in Santiago de Cuba.
What is the official language spoken in Jamaica, which was formerly a Spanish possession known as Santiago?
This Jamaican athlete is a multiple Olympic medallist and the second woman in history to win two consecutive 200 m events at the Olympics.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Veronica Campbell-Brown

questions.question: What are the colors of the national flag of Jamaica?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gold, black and green

questions.question: The indigenous Taino inhabitants of Jamaica named the island Xaymaca. What does this word mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Land of wood and water

questions.question: What is the second-largest Cuban island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isla de la Juventud

questions.question: The Palacio de los Capitanes Generales is the official residence of the Cuban President.
What is the literal meaning of the phrase sado or chado, which refers to the traditional Japanese tea ceremony?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The way of tea

questions.question: Of what descent is the predominant population of Jamaica according to the 2001 census?
What is the largest and highest mountain range on the island of Jamaica?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue Mountains

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: New Jersey and Tea
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, kind, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these famous singers was born in the U.S. state of New Jersey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whitney Houston

questions.question: What is sometimes served along with the thick tea called koicha at the Japanese tea ceremony?
What is the state animal of the U.S. state of New Jersey?
What item from the Japanese tea ceremony equipment is the chakin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A cloth

questions.question: What important law was passed in New Jersey on December 17, 2007, by Governor Corzine?

options.text: Ban on smoking in public places

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elimination of capital punishment

questions.question: What kind of images of calligraphy will be appropriate as a decoration for a Japanese tea ceremony that is held at night?
What is the name of the traditional Japanese way of sitting used on formal occasions such as the Japanese tea ceremony?
In which style of the Japanese tea ceremony are the host and guests seated at tables?
What is the state flower of the U.S. state of New Jersey?
What is traditionally offered to the guest along with kaiseki, the full course meal served before the Japanese tea ceremony?
What vegetable nickname has been given to the U.S. state of New Jersey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tomato State

questions.question: Which of these traditional Japanese meals is served at the Japanese tea ceremony?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The word chabana, which is related to the traditional Japanese ceremony, refers to which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flower arrangement

questions.question: What do the host and the guest receiving the tea bowl traditionally do at the Japanese tea ceremony?
Which of these statements is true about the U.S state of New Jersey?

options.text: It is the third most densely populated state according to a 2009 estimate.
It is the most populous U.S. state according to a 2009 estimate.
It is the least populated U.S. state according to a 2009 estimate.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Germany and Sri Lanka
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, eltz, johannisburg. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what style was the Royal Palace in Wurzburg, Germany built?
Sri Lanka was known by this name in the past.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In the center of the German city Karlsruhe there is a palace from which the streets radiate outwards.
What city houses the oldest university in Germany?
Where are the Augustusburg and Falkenlust palaces located?
The Nymphenburg Palace is a baroque palace situated in the center of Berlin.
Reichenau Island, which was declared a World Heritage Site because of its monastery, is in southern Germany.
What is the capital city of Sri Lanka?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sri Jayawardenapura Kotte

questions.question: Chiemsee is a lake in Bavaria, Germany.
New Jersey remained the only U.S. state to lack which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: State song

questions.question: Schloss Johannisburg is a castle in Aschaffenburg, Germany.
What is Burg Eltz?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a medieval castle in Germany

questions.question: Mühlburg is a borough of Berlin, the capital of Germany.
What is the official language adopted by the government of Sri Lanka?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Which of these Academy Award-winning actors was born in the U.S state of New Jersey?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Douglas
